snippet: James, tightly guarded by Andre Iguodala with the score tied near the end of Game 1, made a potentially costly decision in opting for a long jumper instead of driving to the basket.
abstract: Harvey Araton On Pro Basketball column speculates that return of Cleveland Cavaliers small forward LeBron James may not guarantee NBA title for team; holds that loss of point guard Kyrie Irving, who fractured knee in overtime of Game 1, puts team at disadvantage and that if James had not missed shot in final moments of regulation play game would not have gone into overtime and Irving would not have been injured.
lead_paragraph: James, tightly guarded by Andre Iguodala with the score tied near the end of Game 1, made a potentially costly decision in opting for a long jumper instead of driving to the basket.

headline.print_headline: James Misses, and a Sense of Destiny Evaporates
headline.main: LeBron James Misses, and a Sense of Destiny Evaporates
